intro: Lampranthus stipulaceus, commonly known as the red-hot poker, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that resemble poker chips. The plant has fleshy, succulent leaves that help it store water, adapting it to arid environments. It blooms during the summer months, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. Lampranthus stipulaceus is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant colors and drought-resistant properties.
